item.title: All Overwatch 2 Ranks | How to Hit Top 500
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/all-overwatch-2-ranks-how-to-hit-top-500/

Like all other competitive games, Overwatch 2 has a popular ranked mode that gamers can play and climb up the skill ladder. With multiple different ranks to hit, getting to the top is no easy feat. Here is a list of all the Overwatch 2 ranks and how you can hit them.

All Overwatch 2 Ranks

Below is a list of all the ranks in Overwatch 2:

  • Bronze (V, IV, III, II, I)
  • Silver (V, IV, III, II, I)
  • Gold (V, IV, III, II, I)
  • Platinum (V, IV, III, II, I)
  • Diamond (V, IV, III, II, I)
  • Master (V, IV, III, II, I)
  • Grandmaster (V, IV, III, II, I)
  • Champion (V, IV, III, II, I)
  • Top 500

The game follows a pretty standard ranking system, featuring five levels in almost all of them, with five being where you start and one being the final level before ranking up. The game uses Matchmaking Rating (MMR), which many other games use too to calculate ranks.

However, the final rank, Top 500, is quite impressive to hit. Not many games have a final rank that specifies what number you are in the world in the game. This gives players a global leaderboard to strive to get their name on, making the game just that much more competitive.

How to Rank Up in Overwatch 2 | Guide to Top 500

To rank up in Overwatch 2 you simply must play ranked matches. As you progress through the game’s ranked system, you will find games tend to get much more difficult, as ranked uses skill-based matchmaking when putting you in matches.

Getting your name on the Top 500 list is not something that can just be done overnight. Many competitive Overwatch players spend countless hours grinding ranked and never even hit the Top 500.

Still, by winning matches, players can move up in the ranks.

When you first start playing ranked mode in Overwatch 2, the game will have you unranked for a series of games before calculating what badge you should receive.

While your first rank will not be Grandmaster or Champion, some players may start at as high as Gold.

For more Insider Gaming guides on video game ranks, check out a list of all the ranks in Dota 2.

item.title: Best Black Friday Deals for Pokémon Fans | Save Money!
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-black-friday-deals-for-pokemon-fans-save-money/

Excited for Black Friday this year? Every year, loads of deals are released for both Pokémon cards and Pokémon games. So, what deals do Pokémon fans have to look forward to this year?

Here are the best 2024 Black Friday deals for Pokémon fans.

Best Pokémon Game Black Friday Deals

As of now, there have been no revealed Black Friday deals for Pokémon video games. However, games such as Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl, Arceus and others could easily be getting a deal this year.

Where to Find Pokémon Game Black Friday Deals:

  • Walmart
  • Target
  • Best Buy
  • Amazon
  • Nintendo eShop

We will keep you updated as more information is released over the next few weeks.

Best Pokémon Card Black Friday Deals

Not worried about the games, but instead want to grab some Pokémon cards on Black Friday? Luckily, we already know of a few special deals for this year’s popular shopping holiday, many of which are available now.

All Pokémon Card Black Friday Deals:

  • Stellar Crown Booster Box ($104.95 at Walmart)
  • Trick or Trade BOOster Bundle ($12.97 at Walmart)
  • Shrouded Fable Elite Trainer Box ($33.75 at Walmart)
  • Battle Academy ($10.99 at Miniature Market)

While the deals listed above are the only current deals ahead of Black Friday, Pokémon fans should expect more to be announced just ahead of the day. In fact, we will probably see a few deals drop on Black Friday and Black Friday only.

Where to Shop for Pokémon Cards Black Friday?

Like the Pokémon games, the cards also have a set of stores that players should head to if they want Black Friday deals. Pokémon cards are a hot commodity, though, so expect any deals to go extremely fast.

Stores with Black Friday Deals on Pokémon Cards:

  • Target
  • Walmart
  • Best Buy
  • Miniature Market

While the stores listed above are massive chains, you might have a local card shop in your area doing deals on Pokémon cards. It is always best to check those out and support local businesses.

Will you be buying anything Pokémon-related this Black Friday?

For more Insider Gaming Pokémon news, read how to get the Promo 10 Mewtwo card in Pokémon TCG Pocket.

item.title: MultiVersus Makes Changes To How Players Unlock Fighters
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/multiversus-makes-changes-to-how-players-unlock-fighters/

MultiVersus is making major changes to how players can unlock fighters in the game.

Developer Player First Games has announced the new “Fighter Road”. Starting November 12, this is the new way for players to unlock fighters in a more straightforward way than in the past.

“At its core, Fighter Road is a streamlined way to earn characters through an easy-to-follow progression track that players can tackle at their own pace,” the studio said. “This is a great way for MultiVersus players to get their hands on the game’s robust and diverse cast of characters.”

RELATED: Warner Bros. Games Focusing on Batman, Mortal Kombat, And Hogwarts Legacy Moving Forward

How MultiVersus Fighter Road Works

Fighter road has players earning progress towards unlocking one new fighter at a time. The progress is earned through Fighter Road XP that gets awarded via matches, events, and the battle pass.

Of course, if you don’t want to work to unlock a specific fighter in MultiVersus, you can always just buy them outright with Fighter currency or Gleamium. However, Fighter currency will no longer be available starting with Season 4 on November 12, so what you spend comes from what you’ve earned to that point.

As far as tracking the progress towards fighter unlocks, Player First Games says that characters will be broken down into tiers based on “a number of factors”.

“The first tier, for example, consists of Shaggy, Banana Guard, Wonder Woman, and Batman,” the said. “While characters are unlocked in a specific order in Fighter Road, some tiers allow for players to choose which character they want to work toward unlocking next.

“Characters that are already owned by the player, will be omitted from the Road and, if the player wants to unlock any characters within a tier using their existing character tokens, they can still do so. As players progress on the Fighter Road, their progress will be displayed on a post-match screen that highlights their progress on the reward track.”

Should you complete the Fighter Road and unlock all of the fighters, any additional earned Fighter Road XP will be converted to Battle Pass XP at a 40% rate.

What do you think of the new way to unlock fighters in MultiVersus? Let us know in the comments, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out our extensive interview with inZOI Director and Producer Hyungjun “Kjun” Kim. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Full Details on New Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Maps Released
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/full-details-on-new-call-of-duty-black-ops-6-maps-released/

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Season 1 starts on November 14, and with it comes plenty of additions for players. From weapons to modes to general content, there’s no shortage of new things coming to the game. One area that many fans were excited to learn more about after their tease were the new multiplayer maps for Black Ops 6.

As part of its blog detailing everything for Season 1, Activision gave full details on the new maps coming to the game. In total, there will be four new maps, one remastered map, and one variation coming during Black Ops 6 Season 1.

RELATED: Every New Weapon in Black Ops 6 Season One (and How to Get Them)

The four new maps are Hideout, Heirloom, Extraction, Racket. Hacienda returns from Black Ops 4, and Nuketown gets a Holiday season variant. Three of the maps will be available at launch while the other three come mid-season.

You can get full details on the new maps below via Activision.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Season 1 Maps

Hideout (Launch) – 6v6, Medium-sized

Sharpen your combat skills in this mid-sized Multiplayer map featuring an extensive training site including target practice, an obstacle course, and a lifelike recreation of a vault and security room to help plan for the next mission to hit the Luttazzi crime family.

The vault and blueprints buildings offer intense, multi-level indoor combat while the armory and open bus set the stage to ambush passing enemies. 

Heirloom (Launch) – 2v2, 6v6, Medium-sized

Crash a private showing of Luttazzi family art to create a diversion for the other Rogue Black Ops team as they execute the real job. Navigate in and around a huge sculptural centerpiece in the main exhibit or branch out into the lobby or a side exhibit for a closer fight.

All hell has broken loose in the aftermath of a Crimson One ambush when the attack on the Luttazzis goes sideways. The burning rubble of a downed helicopter and a dead pilot signal an attack on the Avalon Heliport, a typically peaceful tourist destination where clients can book sky high views of Avalon’s breathtaking landscape.

Racket (Mid-Season) – 2v2, 6v6, Small-sized

Time to crack open the heart of the Luttazzi money laundering operation and hit them where it really hurts. Breach the premises in this small-sized underground bank vault, a line of broken tiles marking the path of the center bulldozer placed before the vault of golden bars. Defaced pieces of art and the crossed-out emblem of the Luttazzi family indicate not just greed but malicious intent.

Hacienda (Mid-Season) – 6v6, Medium-sized

Last seen in Black Ops 4, the iconic competitive map returns, sending Operators back to the infamous vineyard estate. Battle within the open-air, two-story mansion with surrounding views of the pristine courtyard below. From the grand foyer past the lion statue, head toward the showroom garage or move out to the garden to keep the fight outside. On the other end of the estate, marvel at the built-in aquarium above the vault.

Nuketown Holiday (Mid-Season) – 6v6, Small-sized

A Holiday-themed version of Nuketown with snow, decorations, and more.

What do you think of the new maps coming to Black Ops 6? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out our extensive interview with inZOI Director and Producer Hyungjun “Kjun” Kim. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
